quotes: In May 2018, Polman received an honorary doctorate from George Mason University.
Polman worked for Procter & Gamble for 27 years, starting in 1979 as a cost analyst,
becoming managing director of P&G U.K. from 1995 to 1998,
president of global fabric care from 1998 to 2001,
and group president for Europe in 2001.
Polman then joined Nestlé in 2006 as chief financial officer
and in February 2008 became vice president and head of the Americas.
On 1 January 2009, Polman succeeded Patrick Cescau as chief executive officer of Unilever.
the company missed sales targets for six out of eight quarters in 2013 and 2014.
